title: Robotics and Automation Training
content:
𝐄𝐫𝐨𝐯𝐨𝐮𝐭𝐢𝐤𝐚, 𝐢𝐧 𝐜𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐚𝐛𝐨𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐰𝐢𝐭𝐡 𝐅𝐨𝐨𝐝 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐇𝐮𝐧𝐠𝐫𝐲 𝐏𝐡𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐩𝐩𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐬, 𝐁𝐫𝐢𝐧𝐠𝐬 𝐑𝐨𝐛𝐨𝐭𝐢𝐜𝐬 𝐄𝐱𝐜𝐢𝐭𝐞𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭 𝐭𝐨 𝐁𝐚𝐬𝐮𝐝 𝐍𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐚𝐥 𝐇𝐢𝐠𝐡 𝐒𝐜𝐡𝐨𝐨𝐥
On February 12, 2025, Erovoutika, in partnership with Food for the Hungry Philippines, introduced high school students at Basud National High School to the world of Robotics and Automation which featured activities like breadboarding and line-following robot training.
A mini competition was also organized to determine the fastest robot to complete the course in one lap. Students were eager to showcase their skills and innovation in this exciting and educational event.
A huge thanks to Food for the Hungry Philippines, the Black & Veatch Foundation Philippines, and the DOST-Technology Application and Promotion Institute for their invaluable support in making this initiative a reality.
We also extend our gratitude to Basud National High School for their warm hospitality.

title: FREESTYLE Category
content:
MGA UNIBERSIDAD, MAGPAPAKITANG-GILAS SA MURATA'S 2ND ROBOTICS COMPETITION
Matinding laban ng talino at technology ang masasaksihan ngayong araw sa Driving Technological Advancement: Murata's 2nd Robotics Competition, kung saan magtatagisan ng galing ang ilan sa pinakamahusay na unibersidad sa bansa sa larangan ng robotics ngayong Lunes, Marso 10, sa First Philippine Industrial Park (FPIP), Brgy. Pantay Bata, Tanauan City, Batangas.
Ang kumpetisyon ngayong taon ay may Free Style Competition, kung saan ipapakita ng mga kalahok ang kanilang innovative design at estratehikong maneuver gamit ang makabagong teknolohiya.
Kabilang sa mga kalahok ang Adamson University, Mapua University, Polytechnic University of the Philippines - Santa Rosa Campus, Technological University of the Philippines - Manila, De La Salle Lipa, at Batangas State University, The National Engineering University.
Ang itatanghal na Champion ay mag-uuwi ng Medalya, tropeo, at P50,000; First Runner-up – P30,000 at Medalya; Second Runner-up – P20,000 at Medalya.
Dinaluhan ang event ng mga kinatawan mula sa DOST-TAPI, PEZA, Erovoutika, Philippine Manufacturing Co. of Murata, Inc., at FPIP, na sumusuporta sa patuloy na pag-usbong ng teknolohiyang pang-inhinyeriya sa bansa.
Ayon sa Murata, ang kompetisyong ito ay bahagi ng kanilang misyon na paigtingin ang kultura ng pagkamalikhain at kahusayan sa larangan ng robotics at engineering. | JMP, BChannel NEWS
author: ERovoutika Electronics Robotics Automation

title: Congratulations to all the winners!
content:
Congratulations to all the winners!
EXCLUSIVE | Various universities across the country showcased their cutting-edge projects at Murata’s 2nd Robotics Competition held on March 10 at FPIP, Brgy. Pantay Bata, Tanauan City, Batangas.
In the Free Style Competition, De La Salle Lipa emerged as the champion with their project "Voice Gest," a voice recognition system designed for the hearing-impaired.
TUP-Manila secured the 1st runner-up spot with "Rise of Agentic AI Robots," while BatStateU-TNEU was named 2nd runner-up for "Project DAHAN," an automated heart-rate assessment system for drivers.
BatStateU-TNEU was also recognized as the People's Choice Awardee, while other participants, including Adamson University, Mapúa University, and PUP-Sta. Rosa, received consolation prizes.
The event was attended by representatives from DOST-TAPI, PEZA, Erovoutika, and Philippine Manufacturing Co. of Murata, Inc., with a panel of industry experts serving as judges. | JMPamintuan, BChannel NEWS

title: Murata Robolution: Robotics & Automation Competition 2025
content:
Murata Robolution: Robotics & Automation Competition 2025 is now happening Philippine Manufacturing Co. of Murata, Inc.
MGA HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS SA BANSA, MAGPAPAKITANG-GILAS SA MURATA'S EROVOUTHON 2.0 COMPETITION
Isang matinding laban ng talino at teknolohiya mula sa mga Junior High School students ang masasaksihan ngayong araw sa Murata's Erovouthon 2.0 Competition, ngayong Biyernes, Marso 14, sa Philippine Manufacturing Co. of Murata, Inc., First Philippine Industrial Park (FPIP), Brgy. Pantay Bata, Tanauan City, Batangas.
Ang bawat kalahok ay magpapakita ng kanilang proyekto o imbensyon na may positibong epekto sa kapaligiran at komunidad, gamit ang mga teknolohiyang tulad ng Bluetooth, Wi-Fi, GSM, iba pang wireless controls, camera image processing, at computer vision. Ang criteria for judging ay binubuo ng Electronics Management na may 20%; Innovativeness na may 30%; Creativity na may 30% at Relevance na may 20%.
Kabilang sa mga kalahok ang Santa Rosa Science and Technology High School, Calamba City Science Integrated School, De La Salle University – Dasmariñas High School, Batangas City Integrated High School, Lipa City Science Integrated High School, at San Pablo City Science Integrated High School.
Ang Champion ay mag-uuwi ng medalya, tropeo, at P50,000; ang First Runner-up ay makakatanggap ng P35,000 at medalya; at ang Second Runner-up ay tatanggap ng P25,000 at medalya. Magkakaroon din ng Consolation Prize na P10,000 para sa mga hindi mapapabilang sa Top 3.
Dinaluhan ang event ng mga kinatawan mula sa DOST-TAPI, Erovoutika, at Philippine Manufacturing Co. of Murata, Inc., na patuloy na sumusuporta sa pag-unlad ng teknolohiyang pang-inhinyeriya sa bansa.
Ayon sa Murata, ang kompetisyong ito ay bahagi ng kanilang misyon na pausbongin at paigtingin ang kultura ng pagkamalikhain at kahusayan sa larangan ng robotics at engineering.| BChannel NEWS
author: ERovoutika Electronics Robotics Automation

title: Junior High School students showcased their exceptional robotics talents during Murata's Erovouthon 2.0 Competition 2025
content:
Congratulations!
Junior High School students showcased their exceptional robotics talents during Murata's Erovouthon 2.0 Competition 2025, held on Friday, March 14, at the Philippine Manufacturing Co. of Murata, Inc. Congratulations to all winners and participants!
Champion: Calamba City Science Integrated School wowed everyone with SENTO GAS, a smart gas leak detection system, earning the grand prize of a trophy, medal, and ₱50,000
First Place: Lipa City Science Integrated High School impressed with AERO-SAFE, an Arduino-based safety system, winning ₱35,000
Second Place: Batangas City Integrated High School secured the spot with Project SAGIP, a gas-detecting robot, and took home ₱25,000
Participants:
• De La Salle University – Dasmariñas, ReplicARM
• Santa Rosa Science and Technology High School, Leaks
• San Pablo City Science Integrated High School, GTec Autobot
Let’s continue to support, uplift and celebrate the Technology and Robotics in the Philippines!
#Murata #robolution2025 #Erovoutika

title: Congratulations to the future leaders who displayed exceptional talent in the Murata Robolution: Erovouthon 2.0 Robotics Competition 2025
content:
Congratulations to the future leaders who displayed exceptional talent in the Murata Robolution: Erovouthon 2.0 Robotics Competition 2025! This initiative of Philippine Manufacturing Co. of Murata, Inc. is set to nurture young minds to real-life application of robotics in solving some of the problems of the company.
 Champion: Calamba City Science Integrated School – "SENTOGAS" Smart Gas Leak Detection and Instant Alert System
 1st Runner-up: Lipa City Science Integrated High School – "AERO-SAFE" (coded using Arduino R3, gas sensors, and a GSM module)
 2nd Runner-up: Batangas City Integrated High School – "Project SAGIP" (independent gas detection and air quality monitoring)
 Special Awards:
Best Presentation: San Pablo City Science Integrated High School
Best Presenter: Calamba City Science Integrated School
A big round of applause to all participants for breaking the limits of innovation and developing solutions that actually make a difference!

title: Calling All Young Math Wizards! 🧠✨ Get ready for the EROMATH REGIONAL COMPETITION
content:
📣 Calling All Young Math Wizards! 🧠✨
Get ready for the EROMATH REGIONAL COMPETITION — a thrilling academic battle designed to challenge and celebrate the brightest young minds in the field of Mathematics!
📊 Whether you're in elementary or senior high school, this is your moment to shine. Compete with fellow math enthusiasts across the region and show everyone the power of logic, strategy, and sharp thinking.
CATEGORIES:
🔹 Category 1: Grades 3-4
🔹 Category 2: Grades 5-6
🔹 Category 3: Grades 7-8
🔹 Category 4: Grades 9-10
🔹 Category 5: Grades 11-12
🎯 Why join EroMath?
Because it's more than just a quiz—it's a gateway to excellence! Regional champions will advance to the NATIONAL ROUND, where even bigger prizes and greater recognition await. But that’s not all...
🏆 ALL NATIONAL WINNERS will receive an exclusive automatic slot to compete in ROBOLUTION DUBAI and FIBONACCI INTERNATIONAL MATHEMATICS OLYMPIAD IN TURKEY AND ITALY—an internationally renowned competition that brings together top talents from around the globe! 
Don't miss this once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to:
✅ Represent your school and region
✅ Win amazing prizes
✅ Build confidence and critical thinking
✅ Compete on an international stage
Prepare. Compete. Conquer.
Be part of the EROMATH journey and let your brilliance be known!

title: 𝐓𝐞𝐚𝐦 𝐏𝐡'𝐬 𝐬𝐢𝐛𝐥𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐝𝐮𝐨 𝐛𝐚𝐠𝐬 𝐦𝐮𝐥𝐭𝐢𝐩𝐥𝐞 𝐚𝐰𝐚𝐫𝐝𝐬 𝐢𝐧 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐅𝐢𝐛𝐨𝐧𝐚𝐜𝐜𝐢 𝐈𝐧𝐭𝐞𝐫𝐧𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐚𝐥 𝐑𝐨𝐛𝐨𝐭 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐌𝐚𝐭𝐡 𝐎𝐥𝐲𝐦𝐩𝐢𝐚𝐝 𝐂𝐨𝐦𝐩𝐞𝐭𝐢𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧
content:
𝐓𝐞𝐚𝐦 𝐏𝐡'𝐬 𝐬𝐢𝐛𝐥𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐝𝐮𝐨 𝐛𝐚𝐠𝐬 𝐦𝐮𝐥𝐭𝐢𝐩𝐥𝐞 𝐚𝐰𝐚𝐫𝐝𝐬 𝐢𝐧 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐅𝐢𝐛𝐨𝐧𝐚𝐜𝐜𝐢 𝐈𝐧𝐭𝐞𝐫𝐧𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐚𝐥 𝐑𝐨𝐛𝐨𝐭 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐌𝐚𝐭𝐡 𝐎𝐥𝐲𝐦𝐩𝐢𝐚𝐝 𝐂𝐨𝐦𝐩𝐞𝐭𝐢𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧
Louise Viviene P. Manila, a Grade 6 student, and her sister Lana Venice P. Manila, a Grade 8 student, currently enrolled in Robotics and Mathematics Program of Erovoutika International Academy, and from FAITH Catholic School, stood out among over 2,000 participants from 18 countries after bringing home multiple awards in the recently concluded Fibonacci EuroAsia Robot Olympiad and the Fibonacci International Mathematics Olympiad, held on April 16 to 24, 2025, in Antalya, Turkey.
At the Fibonacci EuroAsia Robot Olympiad, from April 16-20, 2025, under the mentorship of ERovoutika Electronics Robotics Automation coaches, Louise Viviene placed 3rd in the Drone Rally Competition. The duo also secured three more awards, including the Jury Award for Autonomous Drone Programming and Fast Line Following, and a Special Jury Award for the Mini Sumobot.
Adding to the family's streak of excellence, Lana Venice also competed in the Fibonacci International Mathematics Olympiad from April 20 to 24 under the guidance of Erovoutika team Among over 200 participants, she earned 3rd Place under Category 3 (Grades 7-8).
Their achievements qualified them to participate in the Education and Exchange Program in Italy and Turkey and to represent the Philippines at the Fibonacci International Robot Olympiad Global Finals, set to be held in Italy in November, bringing together the world’s best in robotics, innovation, and engineering.
The sisters were trained by Erovoutika Robotics and Automation Solutions, a leading provider of robotics and automation solutions dedicated to nurturing future innovators in robotics and STEM education.
The Fibonacci International Olympiad is one of the world’s most prestigious competitions, with a mission that directs young minds toward endless discoveries in mathematics and science. It brings together robotics and mathematics enthusiasts from around the world as an expo and educational platform, offering opportunities to engage with leading experts, explore cutting-edge technologies, and develop new collaborations.

title: 🚨🤖 JSUMO IS NOW OFFICIALLY ROBOLUTION TEAM! 🤖🚨
content:
🚨🤖 JSUMO IS NOW OFFICIALLY ROBOLUTION TEAM! 🤖🚨
We’re thrilled to announce the official Contract Signing between Erovoutika and JSUMO held last April 25, 2025, in Turkey — a landmark moment for the robotics community in the Philippines! 🇵🇭
Erovoutika is the exclusive distributor of JSUMO Robots in the Philippines 🇵🇭 — bringing world-class robotics kits and components closer to Filipino innovators, students, and enthusiasts. 
The JSUMO products are trusted by international robotics competitors and educational institutions across Europe, Asia, and the Americas. 🌍
🤝 With this partnership, JSUMO is now an official collaborator of Robolution: Robotics and Automation Competition — the Philippines’ biggest and most prestigious robotics competition! 🏆🔧⚙️🏆
This collaboration represents a giant leap forward in our shared mission to empower the Filipino youth through technology, education, and innovation.
The future of Philippine robotics just got stronger! 💥
💡 Together, we build the future of robotics.
#Erovoutika #JSUMO #Robolution2025 #PhilippineRobotics #RoboticsPartnership #InnovationStartsHere

title: 𝐂𝐀𝐋𝐋𝐈𝐍𝐆 𝐀𝐋𝐋 𝐑𝐎𝐁𝐎𝐓𝐈𝐂𝐒 𝐂𝐋𝐔𝐁𝐒 𝐖𝐎𝐑𝐋𝐃𝐖𝐈𝐃𝐄!
content:
𝐂𝐀𝐋𝐋𝐈𝐍𝐆 𝐀𝐋𝐋 𝐑𝐎𝐁𝐎𝐓𝐈𝐂𝐒 𝐂𝐋𝐔𝐁𝐒 𝐖𝐎𝐑𝐋𝐃𝐖𝐈𝐃𝐄!
Are you leading the charge in innovation, engineering brilliance, and tech-driven teamwork?
Has your club made an impact in your community, wowed at competitions, or inspired the next generation of robotics enthusiasts?
Whether you're based in a local school or an international institution — 𝘵𝘩𝘪𝘴 𝘪𝘴 𝘺𝘰𝘶𝘳 𝘵𝘪𝘮𝘦 𝘵𝘰 𝘴𝘩𝘪𝘯𝘦.
We’re officially 𝗢𝗣𝗘𝗡 𝗙𝗢𝗥 𝗡𝗢𝗠𝗜𝗡𝗔𝗧𝗜𝗢𝗡𝗦 for the prestigious:
🏆 𝐈𝐧𝐭𝐞𝐫𝐧𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐚𝐥 𝐎𝐮𝐭𝐬𝐭𝐚𝐧𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐑𝐨𝐛𝐨𝐭𝐢𝐜𝐬 𝐂𝐥𝐮𝐛 𝐨𝐟 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐘𝐞𝐚𝐫 𝐀𝐰𝐚𝐫𝐝 🏆
to be awarded at 𝐑𝐨𝐛𝐨𝐥𝐮𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐃𝐮𝐛𝐚𝐢 𝟐𝟎𝟐𝟓 on 𝐃𝐞𝐜𝐞𝐦𝐛𝐞𝐫 𝟏𝟓–𝟏𝟖, 𝟐𝟎𝟐𝟓 at 𝐀𝐋 𝐁𝐀𝐑𝐒𝐇𝐀, 𝐃𝐔𝐁𝐀𝐈.
This global recognition celebrates clubs that go above and beyond in innovation, education, community service, and collaborative spirit in the world of robotics.
---
The 𝐈𝐧𝐭𝐞𝐫𝐧𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐚𝐥 𝐎𝐮𝐭𝐬𝐭𝐚𝐧𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐑𝐨𝐛𝐨𝐭𝐢𝐜𝐬 𝐂𝐥𝐮𝐛 𝐨𝐟 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐘𝐞𝐚𝐫 𝐀𝐰𝐚𝐫𝐝 honors the robotics club that has demonstrated exceptional performance, innovation, and dedication in the field of robotics. This prestigious accolade is given to a club that has not only excelled in competitions but has also made significant contributions to the robotics community through outreach, education, and teamwork.
Minimum Qualification/s:
1. An accredited robotics organization in institutions;
Documentary Requirement/s:
1.   Endorsement Letter from the Principal/Dean
2.   Accomplishment Report of programs and projects conducted with documentation and other attachments as proof. Include all approval letters/activity permits.
3.   Supporting Documents
a.   Accomplished Application Form for Outstanding Robotics Club of the Year
b.   Awards / Certificates of Appreciation / Recognition or Plaques / Medals duly identified and labeled and other proof of awards
c.    Certificate of attendance/participation
d.   Certificate of Accreditation issued by the school where the club affiliated with.
e. Certificate of Membership and community organization (e.g International Robotics Club) 
If none, any representative of the group may join on the International Robotics Club for students: 
Registration link: https://bit.ly/IRCregistration
f. Office Order for Regional to International Events (if a partnership, Memorandum of Agreement)
g. Other documents to support the claims.
Criteria:
Relevant / Accomplished Activities                                   40%
Awards / Commendation / Additional Activities              30%
Certificate of Membership                                                10%
Robolution Participation                                                   20%
TOTAL                                                                              100%
PROCESS FOR APPLICATION
1.   Fill out the Google form thru this link: https://forms.gle/dWP4pnd3N2MaPyMi9 
2.   Upload all required documents through the form.
3.   Your submission will undergo a thorough review.
4.   The deadline for submission is on or before November 25, 2025.
In Partnership: Philippine Manufacturing Co. of Murata, Inc.  
Supported by: Technology Application and Promotion Institute 
#InternationalOutstandingRoboticsCluboftheYear
#Erovoutika

content:
𝐔𝐧𝐢𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐬𝐢𝐭𝐲 𝐨𝐟 𝐒𝐚𝐧 𝐂𝐚𝐫𝐥𝐨𝐬- 𝐍𝐨𝐫𝐭𝐡 𝐂𝐚𝐦𝐩𝐮𝐬 𝐏𝐫𝐞𝐬𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐬: 𝐑𝐨𝐛𝐨𝐥𝐮𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝟐𝟎𝟐𝟓 – 𝐇𝐢𝐠𝐡𝐥𝐢𝐠𝐡𝐭 𝐕𝐢𝐝𝐞𝐨 🎉
Step into the world of innovation, intelligence, and imagination as Robolution 2025 takes over the University of San Carlos - North Campus! 🚀
Watch as students showcase their talents and technical brilliance in three exciting categories:
- Line Following Robot – Precision meets speed as teams race their autonomous bots through complex tracks, testing sensors, logic, and engineering under pressure.
- Freestyle (Innovative Category) – Witness creativity unleashed! From smart tech solutions to game-changing prototypes, these young inventors are pushing the boundaries of what’s possible.
- EroMath (Mathematics Challenge) – Where numbers meet nerve. Watch participants solve complex math problems with lightning speed and accuracy, proving that robotics and mathematics go hand in hand.
Get inspired. Get amazed. And get ready for what’s next.

title: 𝐓𝐞𝐚𝐦 𝐏𝐡𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐩𝐩𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐬 𝐒𝐡𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐬 𝐚𝐭 𝟏𝟑𝐭𝐡 𝐑𝐨𝐛𝐨𝐭𝐢𝐜𝐬 𝐂𝐡𝐚𝐦𝐩𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐬𝐡𝐢𝐩 𝐢𝐧 𝐎𝐫𝐚𝐝𝐞𝐚, 𝐑𝐨𝐦𝐚𝐧𝐢𝐚
content:
𝐓𝐞𝐚𝐦 𝐏𝐡𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐩𝐩𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐬 𝐒𝐡𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐬 𝐚𝐭 𝟏𝟑𝐭𝐡 𝐑𝐨𝐛𝐨𝐭𝐢𝐜𝐬 𝐂𝐡𝐚𝐦𝐩𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐬𝐡𝐢𝐩 𝐢𝐧 𝐎𝐫𝐚𝐝𝐞𝐚, 𝐑𝐨𝐦𝐚𝐧𝐢𝐚
Team Philippines proudly made its mark on the global stage as Team Philippines delivered a powerful performance at the 13th Robotics Championship held at the University of Oradea, Oradea, Romania.
Emerging among the top contenders from around the world, Filipino students brought home multiple awards in various categories, demonstrating excellence in innovation, programming, and robotics design.
🥇 1st Place – Freestyle Category: Colegio de Muntinlupa
🥇 1st Place – Super AI Category: Claret School of Quezon City
🥈 2nd Place – Freestyle Category: Eromed - Erovoutika International Academy
🥈 2nd Place – Line Following Enhanced: Cam Norte Robotics Team
🥈 2nd Place – Super AI Category: Frames - Erovoutika International Academy
🥉 3rd Place – Freestyle Category: Closet Mate Frames - Erovoutika International Academy
🥉 3rd Place – Super AI Category: Smith - Erovoutika International Academy
Coach: Engr. Freddiereck Boringot - Erovoutika International Academy
This outstanding performance showcases the Philippines’ growing strength in STEM and robotics education. The event gathered young innovators from various nations, offering a platform to share technological knowledge, promote creativity, and foster international collaboration.
author: ERovoutika Electronics Robotics Automation
